abstract: Officials in Kansas City, Mo, are eagerly anticipating construction of minimum-security prison near downtown, as it will replace release center that has prompted complaints from residents and business leaders about men loitering and causing trouble in area; question of what will happen to men in center, who have been released from prison but do not have place to live, is unresolved.
lead_paragraph: A looming question is what will happen to the 135 people housed in the Kansas City Community Release Center, which officials hope to have converted to a minimum-security prison.

headline.main: Men at Kansas City Release Center Worry as Prison Plans to Move In
headline.print_headline: Home for Ex-Convicts Selected as Prison Site

snippet: A looming question is what will happen to the 135 people housed in the Kansas City Community Release Center, which officials hope to have converted to a minimum-security prison.
